First off, don't get fooled by my played hours, I've been playing it way before it was avaiable on steam but I didn't touch it since around 1.5 years. I would estimate that my played hours are somewhere around 3k, I've also participated in 2 tournaments. I would still love this game and recommend it to everyone and their grandma if Aeria wouldn't have messed up AVA like they did.  AVA was a great game back when ijji published it, it had great potential. The maps are great, nothing to complain about here. You could buy Weapons, Grenades and Armor for ingame money. You would get money relatively slow, but once you hit 50-60k € you could buy a decent, permanent weapon and that's pretty much all you needed. You also need money to repair that weapon and buy parts for your weapon that need to get replaced regularly. Getting 50-60k could take up to 1-2 months, depending on how much you played. You could still spend real money on weapons in order to get them immediately. It still was not pay to win at all. The graphics were actually decent for a F2P game. You would encounter hackers from time to time, depending on whether there were any free hacks out there or not.  Ever since Aeria games took over things changed. Their biggest failure was the removal of permanent weapons, which ultimately made the game pay to win. You could only buy weapons for 30 days, then they expired. The price of a decent weapon was still around 50-60k, and I guess you already see that this is a huge problem. If you don't play 3-4 hours per day you won't be able to get 50-60k per month, that means you have to play with the standard weapons which are not entirely useless, but you would never beat someone who is on the same skill level as you with a standard weapon while he uses his expensive rifle. This also meant that old players will always have an advantage over new players, because they still have their permanent weapons.   The thing is, you may think that the publisher should have no influence on the content of the game, since they are only publishing, but not making it. Redduck is actually making the game, and they do so for several other regions such as Japan/China/Korea. All of those regions still have permanent weapons. In fact, Aeria denied to have anything to do with the change from permanent to timed weapons, but we actually contacted someone from Redduck who told us that they were against that change, but Aeria insisted.  The next point are hackers. Aeria implemented a new anti cheat engine that doesn't do its job at all. There were times where you would run into a hacker every 2-3 games. I can't tell you how it is in its current state tho, since I haven't played since quite some time.  By the way, Aeria introduced the 'Tiered Spender' where you would get additional rewards depending on how much money you spend on their game. That's a nice concept, but the thing is that many of those additional rewards are permanent weapons, which is another aspect that makes it pay to win. Just to give you an idea on what you have to spend for a permanent weapon: In one of those tiered spenders you would get a permanent weapon starting at 7999 AP(a little more than 60€) and ending at 29999 AP(around 210€).  This is coming from someone who sometimes played this game all day long, played 2 tournaments and even made a few videos, my best montage got around 2k views, my overall best AVA video has around 10k views. If you have LOTS of money and can live with the fact that this game is pay to win then by all means, get it. I've been putting a decent amount of money into this game myself, and I would never do it again. Money still doesn't buy you skill, but it surely gives you an huge advantage. The next thing to consider are the hackers, everytime there are free hacks on a certain site AVA will be unplayable, and you might even get banned despite being a legitimate player (At one point hackers were able to use your name, which earned you lots of reports). And then I wish you good luck with Aerias automated support answers when you try to appeal a ban.  In the end it's up to you, but I can not recommend it in its current state.   *UPDATE*  I still play a round or two every few months, and I was positively surprised when I played yesterday. Permanent guns are back, but they are really expensive and it surely will take you quite some time until you have enough money for a good gun. I think they need to either make the weapons cheaper, or give you the option to try them out for free before you buy them permanently. It now feels a lot like back in the days when I still used to play this game all day long, but it still has a few pay to win elements. You are still not going to be able to beat a good player if you are average and spend a lot of money, but it's harder for beginners to get into the game, because it will take lots of time until you found the right gun, can afford it, and got enough money to buy armor as well. So it's not pay to win in the sense that bad players will defeat good players because they spent money, but good players who already have an advantage over new/bad players will have an even bigger advantage, so expect to have a hard time in the beginning if you plan on playing AVA.   If you are starting out I recommend you check out some guides because there are some things you should know that are not immediately obvious. Here is an (old) thread that's actually meant for players who want to play AVA competitively, but still is relevant and could give you some useful tips:  http://www.aeriagames.com/forums/en/viewtopic.php?t=1885997   Hackers are still around, but it's not as bad as it used to be. It is understandable that they can't prevent hacking, because they can only react to hacks after they have been released for the most part. They surely are doing things to stop hackers before they actually get to do any damage, we have XIGNCODE after all. It's similar to bugs and glitches, if you programming a game or program you are going to try to avoid bugs, but you can't eliminate every single bug before they actually occured. The best you can do is try to prevent them to your best ability, so there will be as few bugs as possible.  So, I still don't recommend this game, altho it got a lot better. AVA is on a good path right now and maybe I will one day be able to recommend it again. I even think I'm going to play it more regularly from now on. Maybe I will give AVA a positive review one day, but today is not that day.

First of all, I have been playing this game for 5 years and I have witnessed the decline of this game.  To start of with the positives:  + Good graphics. + Wide selection of weapons. + Wide selection of maps and game modes. + You used to be able to play this game for hours on end and not get bored.   Now for the negatives:  - The most cancerous community you can ever imagine. Full of 12 year olds who spam constantly and cry about pretty much everything, they single-handedly destroy this game without the following negatives being taken into account.  - No functioning mute button which is really needed with this community.  - Cheaters, they tend to come in waves when public cheats are released. Think cheaters in games such as CSGO are a problem? There is probably a 75% chance that you will face at least one cheater in the Matchmaking channel each game you queue up for - unfortunately that figure is not greatly exaggerated and that is only considering the kids running around with blatant wall hacks and 1 hit kill cheats.  - Terrible publisher, they honestly do not give a fk about what the community wants unless it affects their income in a positive way. Sure, I understand it is a business, but not investing in a functioning anti-cheat, and instead focusing on the new tier-spender (a pay-to-win model) to satisfying those credit card whales is not the way to maintain a game.  - Non-functioning anti-cheat, it's clearly not doing its job properly, and it gives random errors to legit players such as myself causing my game to crash for no reason.  - Free-to-play, you'd think this would be a positive, but any kid that gets banned cheating can easily make a new account and farm it to a level in a few hours which allows them back into matchmaking.  - Lag, this game has two servers to serve 6 continents; the EU server is supposed to support Europe, Africa and Asia whereas the NA server is supposed to support North America, South America and Oceania. It is not uncommon to face teams with 200+ pings on their closest server, and this game does not have an effective IP-restriction for those countries for which the license does not cover.  - Hit registration, if you play CSGO you've probably heard the common quote 'Volvo pls fix 64 tick servers', and guess what, AVA is a significant downgrade on those servers, I believe somewhere in the region of 16 tick servers. This coupled with extreme laggers (the average ping in EU is probably around 70 and over 150 in NA) leads to countless frustrating encounters where you hit people first on your screen but end up dying behind a wall to a 300 ping BR.  - RNG elements, in a competitive FPS, you would expect RNG (random number generation) to be kept to a minimum, but this game has shooting mechanics which revolve around RNG. First is bloom (how much the bullets spread while spraying) which is fine to have as RNG, but the other is damage - I have been in countless situations where I have head shot someone with a Para (one of the highest damage rifles which is usually a 1 hit head shot) but then die because he didn't die but sprayed 2 AK47 bullets (a lower damage rifle) into my stomach. In short, head shots are not rewarded sufficiently in this game.   - Updates, in short, there is a lack of new content in new updates, it revolves around the pay-to-play whales where they are given new weapons to pay for (and at an obscene amount too).   Do not waste your time with this game, the community is pure cancer, they are the most stupid people you will ever come across in your life. One last thing you should know is that even if this game has 5000 active players (which is a very high estimate), the most recent public cheat had something like 3500+ downloads if I recall correctly.

Playing this game for about five years going on six and seeing the different changes that have affected this game makes me ashamed of how long I've played this game, I have developed many perspectives for this game. Playing when IJJI had the game was when A.V.A was at its prime, back when the guns actually took skill to use, and how the competitive scene was just being born. But ever since Aeria Games has taken over the game, they have reduced the game to its limit. Milking every dollar they could make, removal of permanent guns and the implementation of timed weapons. Poor server maintenance, etc. First off this game is a fast paced, intense action first person shooter. Second the guns in this game are well made considering most of the guns are based off real guns. (excluding Mega Capsules, Blue tickets, Red Tickets, Etc.) Third, the maps are OKAY, not well made, it's basic maps, some maps are so outdated that they don't even bother fixing the glitches/bugs in most of the maps. (but the maps that are played the most are updated a lot.) Fourth, this games graphics are fairly outdated for the North American version (UAVA), but seeing what the future updates will bring forth has made me more interested in this game. Such as HD textures. Currently in TAVA (Taiwan AVA) they have HD Textures which are considered a huge thing. Fifth, is the competitive scene, back in 2009-2012 the competitive scene was at its best. ieSF was a huge contribution to the competitive scene, they made the players strive towards perfection at this game. But sadly ieSF has stopped including A.V.A in their games list, because of lack of players in the competitive scene. Many of you might know Skadoodle of team iBuyPower from CS:GO, he has played this game professionally and has competed in ieSF, considering this is the first game that he ever played competitively and has achieved the most in. It is sad how the players quit because of the lack of competition because poor anti-cheat, poor game design, etc. All the things I have listed here are mostly cons of why I don't recommend this game. And now I will list the Pros of this game, there are a few dedicated players willing to do whatever it takes to make this game better and improve the amount of players, to have a permanent gun in this game, you had to be playing before they removed the permanent option. If you live near the servers, (Example: Canada) you will have at least 1 ping or 2 depending if you have good internet or not, this game is a really good game to help your aim. It's easy to warm up for games like CS:GO, it will make your aim better, you could have fun playing this game if you play with friends. That pretty much it. Aside from the fact that the people installing this game just for the 'Black Rose' knife in TF2 and then uninstalling this game right after. It installs a keylogger into your system, but it does nothing. I promise you it doesn't do anything to your PC. But uninstalling it without playing it is stupid in my opinion. At least play the game, who knows? Maybe you will end up liking the game and maybe pay money to actually get permanent weapons. Overall my final verdict for this game is 6.5/10, it used to be 9/10 but ever since the heavy impacts it took, I don't recommend this game. Pay 2 Win, used to be balanced. Don't download unless you have played since 2011 and have perm guns. Enjoy!

Error: Suspicious program detected! Close all other programs you have running and restart the game.  It comes in a small window with fancied up window titles such as ★------S-e-c-u-r-i-t-y------a-l-e-r-t------★ (it's randomised) and an all but dodgy picture of a private investigator holding a magnifying glass.  It doesn't tell you which program is suspicious, but instead asks you to submit a logfile that is not humanly readable, assumably with data about your running processes. At this point I wonder, why even ask? They already sniffed through your system.   Terrible and non-functional anti-cheat vaporware crap that needs to be killed with fire before it breeds. Pros: - Graphics are somewhat decent - Animations are okay - When the people you're playing with aren't hackers or crying children/teenage boys it is a surprisingly bearable shooter.  Cons: - Hacker paradise - Pay-to-win - Confusing as hell menu screen (took me 5 minutes just to figure out how to get into a game lobby) - DLC are WAY too expensive for a F2P game (Seriously, sixty dollars?? Why????) - Gross 'female models' which break the immersion (not that there was much to begin with) - Game frequently disconnects from servers without any real reason (even on a good wired connection) - Game doesn't even run on fullscreen, plays in a weirdly dimensioned window (it did for me at least, I couldn't find any way to change it to fullscreen or a different resolution) - Did I mention hackers?  AVA was honestly not as ♥♥♥♥♥♥ as I anticipated it to be, but it's not worth your time. Unless you're after the Black Rose, like I was. If you are, the suffering is worth it. Sort of.  All in all? If you want the Black Rose for your Spy loadout, go for it. But otherwise stay FAR away from this money sucker. Your sanity depends on it.

Warning: this review has been re-uploaded intentionally to not only update new info, but to remove previous ratings due to the review's harsh judgement. I will be reviewing this on my own opinions, although some other opinions are quite the same as mine. Also, I have only played this game for at least a several hours, and has been a long time since then. As a result, the review may not be accurate. Regardless, you've been warned.  A.V.A - Alliance of Valiant Arms is a First-Person Shooter where you choose from one of many classes and..well..kill people. Sound familiar? If many answered Call of Duty, Team Fortress 2, or even Counter Strike, you'd likely be here because it looked cool and all.  'Not all is what it seems.'   Okay, before we dip ourselves into the bad parts of this pool, let's go over the good things I have to say of the game.  + Despite me not liking the artwork this game displays on the store or even the logo, the graphics in this game are pretty good, if not decent. And I must say a lot of effort was put into making the game look nice.  + The game functions well, and I haven't suffered a single crash.  + Hackers about? Not likely. Despite all what people said about  'this game is infested with lifeless hackers!',  I am still having a legitimate experience without suffering any ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t such as aimbots, godmode, or any cheats actually. So either they all were ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at some snipers doing some 360 no-scopes, or just wanted to start some rumors on this already down-hill of a game. So in short, not many hackers. That's a plus.  Now, let's list some of the major issues this game has.  - This game is  very  Pay-to-Play influenced. Instead of selling skins and all, there are  actual  weapons being sold as micro-transactions which aren't micro at all. Do you expect me to pay  50$  for a  single  pack of weapons from a Free-to-Play game? No, I wouldn't. It's worse as it encourages people to put money into the game, most recently with the 'Welcome Pack 2016' update.  - The next problem is one people always complain about. People from Team Fortress 2 flock to this game in order to obtain a Spy knife reskin known as 'The Black Rose', a good looking one at that, and was pretty cool before Tough Break came along. To obtain this knife, you simply had to get an achievement in-game. Simple, right? Well, this is where the second flaw comes into play. For some reason..and I mean  for some reason,  the developers thought it was a good idea to prevent you from obtaining any achievements until you beat the  entire  tutorial. You know what that means? You have to sit through an hour or two learning of the game's way of school. And no, not just the basic gameplay. I literally mean  everything.  Only then are you qualified to obtain achievements and obtain 'The Black Rose'. At least, in my experience. When I completed my first round, nothing. However as soon as a beat the tutorial completely, bang! Three achievements, only  one  was the tutorial while the other two was from that previous match. As of me last playing in early 2015, there has yet to be a fix for it other than playing the tutorial like intended.  - From my own experience, the gameplay didn't feel too balanced. The first few lobbys I joined, I went sniper, hence how I'm good with sniping in general. Turns out this Sniper won every game just by camping in a single corner and headshotting everyone on the opposite team while the rest of the team moved up. Even P2Ps who spent 50$+ into the game have fallen before my pathedic F2P Sniper. I don't really intend to try and prove my theory by downloading the game, as it's already 'un-fun' as it is.  - The holy grail to it all is the game's installment. It's files are quite..cruel to other files. In the game's installment, an 'anti-cheat' program is installed that instantly deletes any and all files that the program finds either interfering with the game, and/or because it can. Most cases it was because it could. Why? My Team Fortress 2 graphics looked like they came straight from a missing textured mess from Garry's Mod, and I had to re-install the  entire  game to fix it. Again, this was in my experience. Just uninstall A.V.A once you get what you want from it.  Now with all the major issues out of the way, let's tackle the lesser problems I have with the game.  * The game when launched by steam, launches it's own launcher. It's a small gripe I have. There isn't any real settings to change in said launcher last time I launched it besides maybe screen sizes or fullscreen toggle.  * The community from what I hear is quite..dead. All what's left of it is people probrably hunting for the Black Rose for Team Fortress 2, which by the way, is already losing a good amount of players due to the latest 'Competitive Update'. (I'm looking at you PASS Time..)   Overall, I don't really like this game. While this is a bad game, it isn't  that  bad as people say. The gameplay is decent and the graphics look decent. Just everything is decently good, until the encouragement of 'Pay-to-Play' and bad design choices on terms of coding that made this game fall to the mixed status it is in now.

If you played A.V.A. after I.J.J.I. was the publisher, I'm sorry if this game is trash. Aeria Games made this game unbalanced and unfair for the sake of milking what money they can get. They don't care much for you. I had no problems with the old publisher I.J.J.I. Instead of giving you a story worth of words, I'll list the dislike I had with this game After Aeria became publisher.  1. Temporarily disabled permenant guns. 2. Decreased the amount of money for supply drops. (Was 5,000e/Now2,000e)  3. Removed certain armor and equipment from store and removed option to purchase items for less than 30days and removed certain expandible items from store.  4. Replaced lottery guns with tickets. 5. Removed the option to create clan emblems. 6.Turned co-op missions into some cheesy cyfi ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. You won't take co-op seriously from what they did to it.  7.Ruin infection mode, which was perfectly balanced by, adding stunning spores (removed), giving every infected spores, giving every infected boost ability (F), removing explosion from mines, adding hints for the host infected, removing gear for extra health for humans in store, removing gear for infected from store.  8. Made unneeded changes to co-op. 9.Removed green boxes from survival. 10. Terrible anticheat. 11. Overall ruined the looks and feels of the game and made it cringy and boring.   Aeria said they'll be leaving, which I'm so happy for. Hopefully the new publisher will fix Aeria's mess.  Want to play a good F2P FPS? Play Warface, Warframe, TF2, or No Room In Hell, or even freaking Combat Arms. I would even recommend Comabat Arms.

AVA Had the most interesting and skill based weapon control + recoil mechanics of any shooter in the genre. And then Aeria came along and ♥♥♥♥ed everything over.  Forget the potential of wasting money on this game, or the fact that weapons have made this game incredibly P2W since the para nerf; the customer service alone is reason enough reason that this game has gone to utter ♥♥♥♥. The game rewards weapons that are just point and spray instead of requiring any real skill to use.  After taking a break from the game for many months, I log in to find out that my STEAM ID has been banned from the servers, when I asked Aeria why they refused to give me any information, they just copy and pasted nonsense about sending them the last 5 transaction ID's plus 6 other rediculous questions that I couldn't possibly answer to get my account back.  0/10 will not Aeria ever again.

They call it Free2Play; I call it Free until you reach the point where you realize you need to put in real money to make any meaningful progress. The first 10 levels was fun, especially in the Beginner Channel which is limited to level 1-5/1-10. Next, you're in the Public Channel without level limits; the territory of people who dedicate serious time and real money. Later on, trying to earn game money is almost pointless, so you'll have to put in real money if you want to buy stuff and stay competitive. It'd be better if there were more level specific Channels like 1-15; 1-20; etc. Be prepared to get insta-killed... a lot. You will run into hackers. If you press ESC during a game, it shows three things: disconnect; cancel; REPORT HACKER. That shows how much of an issue it is. Auto Balance is terrible. It balances the amount of players, but not individual scores. Unrelated, but there was one time where some fool had an AK that kills you with only one shot... in the leg. We still won.

Alliance of Valiant Arms is an example of a Pay2Win game. By spending an average amount, you get so much stuff, it will easily over-power anyone who has payed nothing. The sniper rifles are extremely cheap. When using a sniper rifle, once a shot is fired, you can switch to another weapon and then switch back by quickly hitting the q button twice, its like an OP DMR that can one shot anyone under any circumstances. It takes too much time to rank up, and you cannot purchase anything until Rank 8. This will have you stuck with default items for ages. And the ONE thing that made me quit this game is none other than the god forsaken time trails!!! They suck, they are impractical, and just ruins your day when all of your weapons suddenly dissapear. Otherwise, the game is decent in every other perspective. The graphics are nice, controls are smooth, maps and gamemodes are acceptable and even unique in some cases, like Escape (Though Zombie modes suck). Without those, the only thing it has running for it is that its not Combat Arms.

One of the Worst games I have ever played, the gameplay is repetative and offers nothing diffrent from your normal fps. Scernarios especially are repetative has you usally just move through area to area shooting AI enemys which are so stupid they just charge your postition and get mowed down over and over till you find your objective or get to the end of the area. Sure occasinaly you get a guy armed with an rpg who just stands still and fires it over and over at you but that's it AI wise. To say this game has coop is insulting, it was so repetative that I didn't even want to play more than 1 macth of the coop, If i want good coop I would go play Payday 2 sure it costs money to buy it but at least it works with no problems and is fun. Did I mention I had to reboot the game TWICE after booting it up once just to get into 1 macth...1 ♥♥♥♥ING macth. So that's what 3 times I had to boot the game up just to get into 1 macth. Not to mention the so called charecter customization is bare bones has hell only allowing you to choose a face for your guy, which you won't even ♥♥♥♥ing see ever, since the game is played in First Person. Hell even when looking at other peolpes charecters you cna barely see they face anyway, not to mention most of them look the same, most of the faces look the SAME. I played this game for less than 20 minutes and I already don't wish to ever play this game again. Please do yourself a favor and dont even download this piece of ♥♥♥♥ attempt at making a game. The coop is repetative has hell, you will often find yourself doing the same thing over and over in very similiar looking areas making you wonder if you went in a circle or if your going backwards because you cant tell it all looks the same. The Competative multiplayer sucks ♥♥♥, and the game lags like hell and no the lag was not me I turned my settings down to low just to see if it was me, and I still lagged like ♥♥♥♥. With all that and barebones 'Charecter Customizeation' this game even if its free to play is not worth downloading, and if you spent any money on this game I feel sorry for you it really wasn't worth it. Anyway if I were to give this game a rating it would be a 1/10 but after some really ♥♥♥♥ing hard thought I am gonna give it a 2/10 for at least looking like its trying to be a good game. It looks like its actually trying it really does, but it just is so bad and so repatative that I don't see myself or many over peolpe playing this game for more than a few minutes. Summary Good:Free to play Bad: Repetative Coop Missons, Lag out the ♥♥♥, Charecter Customizing is barebones, Competive Multiplaye itself offers nothing new and gets repetative, Is horrandusly boring and Repetative compared to other coop games, Game itself seems to not offer anything new.

However, the hitreg is bad, there's a ton of blatant cheaters...and you literally need to BUY guns and equipment with real money to keep playing the game.  So...should you download this game?  Yes. (edit) Its slipped a lot since then, its overdone the p2w thing, and the overall game quality has slipped. no longer reccomending, not worth the download anymore. Though if you download for the tf2 knife its worth trying to see if you like it for a short period but dont waste long on it and also i suspect they have powered down the servers as the game is generally more laggy and slower, also when aeria took over instead of fixing a glitch they just closed the map as it was a co-op level and the glitch allowed people to get an item as a f2p player that they intended only p2p players to be able to get, thats the ethos aeria has money. The game overall now feels (the europe+usa version at least) that it is only still running to squeeze the remaining money out of the remaining core players.  ALSO SOME ADVICE: If you have ever installed this game then uninstalled and have no intent of playing again or playing another game that uses game guard, the games anti-cheat engine, which is ironically a minor security threat dosent uninstall, if a hacker tried to get into your pc they could make it a threat so i would advise googling how to propery uninstall gameguard. While you have the game installed this is not a problem because it will update, but once the game is uninstalled it will not update if new security risks emerge so could become a problem.  Edit, ava has recently been acuired by a new company that bought areia, will see if anything changes and update this review if any significant changes come to my attention. (edit) Nope.

Ugh. Lets all just say it. You are here so you can get the TF2 item.  Let's break down how terrible this game is.  There is a complete lack of good graphics, and frankly ugly. 4.5/10 This game used to be absolutely stunning during its IJJI era. I've started playing this game way back in around 2008-2009 before it was even on Steam, so my hours are far more than what I actually have on Steam. There used to be a lot more players, a healthier community, and a lot less hackers. Now, it's simply pay2win and full of trash talkers/♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ players. Although the gameplay itself has not changed much in the past years, the state of the game has deteriorated significantly. With the removal of permanent guns a couple of years ago, it has only gotten worst. The company releases OP guns that cost real money, and most of the time they aren't even permanent and only timed for around 30 days or less. AeriaGames has recently announced that they would bring back some of the permanent guns, but that won't fix the damage it has done in the past 3 years. We'll see what direction the game goes towards now.  Other Notes: -Competitive scene is trash. Only a few good players are left, and the rewards are not very tempting. Hence my profile -Servers are horrible. I get ~10 ping in CSGO, while mine is 100+ in NA servers and 150+ in EU servers. -Consistent shots that do not get 'registered,' meaning if two guys shoot at the same time, only one of theirs will register(depends on their ping. -Game tempts you to buy Mystery Boxes for AP, its mostly a scam as you'll have ~1% chance to get something good. -Grenades are BS. -Huge difference between guns bought with real money and guns bought from ingame money with a few exceptions in the more difficult guns( SA58 PARA & AK12) The ONLY reason I gave this game a 4.5/10 is because I still value the memories I've had on this game since I started ~6-7 years ago. I would've gave this game a 9/10 back then as it was growing consistently under IJJI. Many people are quitting everyday, or simply lose interest because of how there are little to none permanent guns. I planned on spending my 10$ of steam wallet for AeriaPoints, but instead I decided to buy CSGO on sale. It was one of the best choice I've ever made .  I used to play competitively in AVA in my prime, CGO and ESL. My team and I were quite good, winning a few tournies and sometimes came in as runner-ups. It's a shame that it now favors towards the EU players( aka Crackheadz and Reves) as the tournaments(though they're really pitiful tournies) are held in EU servers instead.

Step 4: Play 1 round Step 5: Make sure you got the achievement 'First One Down'. Step 6: Close A.V.A. Step 7: Open TF2 (Team Fortress 2) Step 8: Make sure you get the Black Rose. Step 9: Close TF2. Step 10: Open Steam. Step 11: Go to Library/Games. Step 12: Right Click A.V.A. Step 13: Click 'Delete Local Content' Step 14: Make sure A.V.A. is uninstalled. Step 15: Enjoy your Black Rose!

I just played this game to get a Team Fortress 2 promotional item, but I did play the game for at least an hour to get an idea of how well the game was made; it was pretty bad. I've been told that it has been updated, but I doubt it has really improved by a lot. The game has relatively good graphics but displeasing gameplay. Killing people is extremely easy which makes killing unimpressive and unsatisfying. Players in this game tend to be very horrible at first-person shooters, making winning for your team almost effortless. The upgrades on your weapons make your player even more over-powered, as you receive extremely beneficial upgrades on your weapons whereas other players still have default un-upgraded weapons. This makes playing even more easier. The gamemodes almost mimic Counter-Strike and I would daresay this game is merely just a low-funded copy of Counter-Strike. I would not recommend this game unless you're seriously bored and craving to dominate other players... the fun in this game can only last so long.

Don't listen to most of these reviews, as almost all the negative ones are from people that download it just to get the Black Rose knife in TF2 and don't take the time to even try to game. AvA has it's ups and downs and don't let these hours fool you, I've played a good bit on Aeria Games client and now the En Masse client. I figured since all the reviews are down voting the game and they aren't even giving the game as shot I thought Id pich in.  A.V.A was once an amazing free to play shooter, it had everything you wanted / needed in shooter and then of course Aeria Games does what they do best, and ruin titles by making them pay to win. First they started off by removing PERM weps and thats when it all went down hill.. back when IJJI had this game, it was amazing.  Aeria Games hurt this game badly, and honestly I don't see it recovering. Although A.V.A now has a decent publisher (En Masse) I just don't see the damage from Aeria Games being fixed. The likely hood of players giving this a game a shot again is very low.  The game is old, dying, and full of hackers. En Masse does a pretty good job of getting rid of all the hackers but they have yet to replace the anti cheat (XIGN CODE 3) so after banning someone, they simply make a new account. Also, En Masse banning hackers is hurting the game as well, as majority of A.V.A's player base is hackers, the player base has now suffered. I truly believe this is the reason Aeria never banned, as if they banned they would lose players and that would mean losing money. Overall the gameplay is fun as hell and very good for a FREE title. As a free player you CAN compete with someone who pays, but the game has too man problems and honestly don't see it ever changing now.  Give the game a shot, it's free. En Masse has done wonderful things already, but the damage has been done, sadly. If anything, download to get the BLACK ROSE!

Pros: -Black rose  Cons: -The black rose is considered an 'Achievement item', and so, it is not tradeable. -The signup page which you have to go to uses HTTP rather than HTTPS, which means that the password and email which you enter into it are not encrypted, and so, anyone else using the same wireless network as you can read both your password and email as they are being sent. Use a fake email (You don't need to verify your email) and a simple password which you will never use for any service to counter this, as all you need to type in on the login screen is the username and password you chose. -You have to give the game administrator privileges every time you start it. This means that the game has full access to your computer: It can install new programs, delete system files, or install malware or rootkits, etc. Even if the developers don't program such things, any vulnerability in this buggy game would allow a hacker unlimited access to your computer. -The game UI is horribly designed. It seems like the developers were testing how many buttons they can cram onto a single screen as possible without having tooltips on any of them. -You are not allowed to create a character with more than 10 letters or numbers in the name, and almost every combination is already taken, so you will need to keyboard mash until you get a combination which has not been used. -Pay to win

Farewell, AVA... another great game that got ruined by the publisher (in this case, Aeria Games).  AVA (this version of it... for those who are unaware a lot of F2P games have separate versions for different service areas, e.x. North America, Europe, Korea, etc, AVA is no different) was originally published by the now-defunct ijji. ijji sold the publishing rights of AVA to Aeria Games. Unfortunately, Aeria Games goes against many of the values I saw ijji had. ijji was decent at being involved with the community, listening to their feedback, and not trying to just grab everybody's cash. Aeria Games is exactly the opposite, they have ZERO community involvement, and are always scheming for a way to get their hands on your money. Before, you used to be able to buy weapons permanently. Now many weapons are 'rented.' Instead of paying $15 for a permanent gun, you now pay $15 for 30 days use of that gun. Not to mention that AVA used to not be so concerned about usage duration, they had (keyword: had) a system where equipment would degrade as you used it rather than just expiring after a set amount of time.

My god..this game. This game is by far the worst game ever I have ever played in my entire life and what will be the rest of it. I gave a positive review to Bad Rats, a game about terrorist rats that massacre and desecrate cats among other animals. But.. this f-ucking game, this game is the worst thing I have ever lied my eyes on. I after downloading it for an excessive amount of time as it is way too large for a game that has no content I started it up just to see I had to spend another 45 minutes in the game launcher installing patch and updates. I started a character, FPS dropped almost instantaneoulsly. I saw before my eyes,the worst game ever, terrible graphics, disgusting rendering, the worst optimization of any game, even of all games by Unity combined. It was like looking at a dead baby fetus get cut open and sucked through a sick persons mouth. It was the most disgusting and revolting thing I've ever laid my eyes on.   I changed the graphic settings and options to lowest. Now,keep in mind, I can run Arma III on high perfectly fine around 30 frames-per-second, but this game even on the main menu on several graphical settings, I can only run it 10-15 laggy fps at times, the mouse stutters and it feels like my brain is being put through a blender. I can feel the heat of the game, the complete aftermath of the warmth of the aspect of radiation surrounding the game after getting completely and brutally ♥♥♥♥♥. I started the tutorial only to see my frames per second drop to 1-3 at a time. I felt like I was getting several blows of a metal bat to the head. I felt light-headed, queazy and nauseous. I felt the pain and my stomach drop like someone had a knife at my throat, ready to end my life, if that was the real situation,at this point,I would've wanted to die.   The game was popping up with blaring alerts and irritating notifications while the volume was excessively loud even though I had it at a regular level. I saw someone running but when I tried to press WASD, the game was stuttering and trying to keep up with the horrific graphical settings. I could barely set a foot forward when the unexpected happened. One of the worst games and terribly looking and shouldn't require any processing power completely crashed after a 2-4 minutes freeze. It was just looking at someone get murdered,it was pathetic and sad. I started it back up,after waiting almost 15 minutes trying to get back to the tutorial,I finally set foot out,it was popping up with random messages that were laggily appearing and disappearing, sounds were going on and off while horribly acted and scripted voices were yelling at me like a few immature autistic kids acting out a play on a playground. It wasn't worth it. All of this was not worth the torment I was being required to suffer through to even play the tutorial for more than five minutes. I was barely just moving around aftering getting yelled pointless instructions at me when the unexpected happened again. It f-ucking crashed again.   I wasn't sure if I could start it up again,it felt like my head had just been cleared. It was as if I was experiencing the worst headache that anyone was to suffer to date and it was instantaneously cleared with no side effects. The game was closed, I didn't think I could handle anymore, I hovered my cursor over the uninstall button craving the pleasure of clicking it and ridding this blight from my PC,my life and as I hoped, my memory. I looked back,thought maybe..just maybe I could suffer through such crucial torture, one more time. I started the game up,feeling droggy. It was as if I was all of a sudden drugged,it felt like I was beaten,thrown into a vehicle,droven miles out to nowhere and thrown out in a field. I felt empty,alone, this game made me feel worse than I can even describe with words,no matter what I see in an enemy, no matter how much I hate someone even with the largest amount of malice,never in my life would I wish someone to have to suffer through the pain that is playing this disgusting excuse of a game. Looking through which seemed to be at this point blurred vision, I saw the horribly designed and just plain gross menu screen. I felt the horror of my past, every memory that seemed to be low points in my life,the horrific memories,I saw myself so desperate at this moment,even craving these moments in exchange at any moment for the release of this pain.    All I wanted now was the sweet release of death, to die rather than see another moment of this game as I clicked on a button to join a match after struggling for several moments trying to sluggily getting through a plethora of banners and ads. I managed to get through it like a maze meant for masochism and pure struggling and frustration. I had finally joined a match,I was okay,I got through it. I made it, I finally made it through the amount of torture I could finally experience. I finally met my complete and full capacity for pain and torture and I was done. I thought I was done through all of this,my frames per second were at zero but I was fine now,I was alright, I could give up now. I had such a high thrist for death, never in a million years I would've thought I could desire this so greatly but at this moment, I was.. and now, it was the only thing in my life that I truly wanted. Then the most depressing and relieving thing coinciding together happened. The game crashed.    I was rid of the pain. I was rid of the sorrow that this game was. I felt like crying but it felt like my memories had been partially exasperated, that the truly evil things in life were gone, the rest of my life would seem to be easier, to be a cake walk, because I had barely made it through this journey that is Alliance of Valiant Arms and I survived after being completely physically exhausted. I was emotionally exhausted. And finally, I was to the fullest extent, mentally exhausted. I had never had such a desire for everything to just fade away, the desire for it all to be quenched. Though,I was relieved and possibly a future patient of post-traumautic stress disorder now after experiening this long and bitter journey. I was done. I felt sorrowuful but I slowly installed the game watching it's memory and mark it left on my computer disappear..forever.So I only have one thing to say to this gam- no, this excuse for a bit of space in this world, this direct spawn of Satan. The most miserable thing that has ever crossed the plane of life and this Earth. 'F-uck you!'

This would be a very decent free-to-play online FPS, unfortunately it's plagued by several things. First off, it's very pay-to-win—players with deep pockets buy the biggest and best guns to dominate the match(a handgun that can kill with one shot to the leg? I think not.). And even most of the items you CAN buy only last for a short amount of time, mostly not even for a whole day. And the 'free' Welcome Package? Having to PURCHASE in-game currency to receive a set of items isn't free, it's a purchase bonus. Call it what it is, don't sugarcoat it.  Then, there's the bugs. Half the time I launch the game, it fails(not anything wrong on my end, I checked), and when I was able to play, several of my simple achievements(such as 'Play as the Rifle Man for the first time') took several unnecessary playthroughs to unlock. Oh, then there's the plagiarized Resident Evil art used in the promo pictures when you launch the game. Shameful.  Honestly, this could've been a great, free alternative to CS:GO. But when all is said and done, it's only worth playing for the initial 15+ minutes to unlock the Black Rose knife for a much better free-to-play online FPS—Team Fortress 2.  2.5/10

Now the thing to note with this review is that I am not complaining about the game. The game is fine, excellent, a real contender to the crap of Battlefield Play4free, but the only thing holding it back is the current licensee of the game, Aeria Games. Once upon a time, there was a company called Redduck, and they created a game called A.V.A. Now they licensed it as a free to play game under Ijji (for the US) and it revolutionized free to play games since it had PERMANENT WEAPONS. not once that timed out after some number of days, PERMANENT WEAPONS. Now, some games had this too, but AVA was different, you could get this permanent weapons for in game money, without ever having to pay a cent, (I was one of these users). In fact, while some would consider the game flopping with multitudes of free users, the game thrived, until Aeria Games noticed the competition and profits this game was making and decided to gain control of this mini-monopoly. While this went smooth at first, things started getting rough when Aeria started offering more and more items using its real money based currency-AP. At first, it was just skins, to make the existing guns look cooler, and no one had any complaints. But then, the game became unbalanced as the free users found themselves being outgunned by better weapons that one had to pay for. A new form of balance was needed, the switch to time weapons. However, while this might have balanced the game instead it ruined a once perfect game, for the OP (overpowered) AP gun were not timed (some were, but most weren't, at first), no, the igc (in-game-currency, the currency you get for playing the game) guns were timed, and soon, it was discovered they were nerfed (made weaker). One by one, the full time AVA players left, never to return again, today the game is in danger of being shut down. A dying FTP game, saving your money and play SF2 (Soldier Front 2). Its still living with events every week, and a growing fanbase, don't waste your time with AVA, under Aeria passes it on, fixes its issues, or worse, shuts the game down.  edit: this game has be ruined too much, there is no point in trying to start to play this game, only play if you are an older player who is returning, not a new player

The only negative thing I could find (apart from the difficulty of obtaining the Black Rose and the virus, as people claim) was the thought given to naming the classes.  Rifle Man, Sniper, and Point Man. I understand not wanting to have any similarity to Team Fortress 2, for example, but you got to think your names through. Another alternative would be to give the classes real names.  Lastly, I personally think players are more interested in video games that have a backstory to them. Take Team Fortress 2. The comics explain a great deal of things that happen in-game.  In conclusion, I would give this game 4 out of 10 stars.

God awful.  -Maps made for a small group of players are too big and maps made for a large group are way too small -Many players have lag beyond 200 ping -Tries to add both running and 'walking' and fails completely (due to having to double tap W to run which is a huge inconvenience) -Infected game mode is unfair due to easy camping spots -Options are hard to change or don't fit good resolution sizes -Overall very buggy and unsmooth gameplay -Has big boobed/cleavage characters to appeal to male audiences -Scopes are literally useless for any gun other than the sniper Plus more.  On the bright side, it's free and weapons could be bought for permanent using in-game currency. There's a decent amount of game styles.  I would recommend this game on the idea that it is pretty solid of a game and it's free. But if you're looking for something that's more than people hiding in holes and shooting each other from far away, skip this.  Obligatory score: 7/10

I'm going to try to write a review that's a little bit more descriptive than the other ones.   AVA is fairly very old game. On high graphics, it looks amazing, albeit, not as good as today's fps games' graphics. The gameplay is fast paced and it feels really good. It was one of the best f2p mmofps's out there. It was even better than some paid fps games. There's a reason as to why I say, 'was one of the best.' That's because everything about this game went to the dumps when ijji handed it over to Aeria Games. Sure, gameplay is relatively the same, but it's just not worth playing anymore. Aeria Games decided to remove one of the best features, permanent guns. If you're bounced around between f2p mmofps games, then you know that permanent guns is a very attractive feature. Permanent guns was one of the reasons that I settled with this game. Next, they decided to make the game pay to win. The only permanent guns that you have are the starter weapons. You need to maintain and repair them by paying with the game's currency. But an update greatly increased the repair prices. In order to maintain your all your guns and still make a profit, you need to play for around 6 hours each day. And those 6 hours aren't even going to pay for the guns that you want to buy. Those are expensive, and they disapear after a month! They made these changes to give players more incentive to play, but in reality, this game has become a chore.  I can no longer recommend this game to anyone because it's not good anymore.

Game installs a rootkit, that does: 'GameGuard hides the game application process, monitors the entire memory range, terminates applications defined by the game vendor and INCA Internet to be cheats (QIP for example), blocks certain calls to Direct X functions and Windows APIs, keylogs your keyboard input[citation needed], and auto-updates itself to change as new possible threats surface.' wikipedia, link is here(  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NProtect_GameGuard  )  if you got this rootkit, go here (  http://www.gamefaqs.com/boards/437678-team-fortress-2/61977486  )  It could look like a nice DRM program, something like VAC, but it protects you also when not playing game. It is a keylogger, logging all your pressed keys (steam info, email,...), eating up space on harddrive and resources (RAM, CPU)...  0/10  NEVER INSTALL OR RUN THIS GAME! NOT EVEN FOR TF2 ITEM, IT ISNT WORTH!

This game.... Oh god, this game... I have never been so mad at a single game in my entire life. Where do I start... Well, firstly, the launcher is total garbage. It constantly crashes, and this dodgy-as-all-hell program pops up speaking of suspicious programs (the irony is killing me). It's also one of those stupid games that, for some unknown reason, don't allow spaces in their names. After finally creating a suitable username, and FINALLY getting the launcher to not ♥♥♥♥ itself and crash, I got into another... launcher. This time it asked me to create a character. Crashed. Tried again, and asked me to create a character with a name. Name didn't support spaces. After about ten minutes of non-stop crashing, and warnings of suspicious programs, ahem, I finally got into the actual game. It was the tutorial. Game ran at a horrible resolution, one which I didn't even bother to check since I was planning on just playing it for a few minutes to get the Black Rose knife for the Spy in TF2. From what I could tell at the time, the gameplay, or what you might call gameplay, was mediocre at best. First thing I noticed was the abhorrent sound quality. Terrible. I have 7.1 surround headphones, and you know something's not right when it sounds horrible even through that. I finally made it through the tutorial, surprisingly without any crashes. As I got to the main menu I was trying to find the specific achievement for the Black Rose, and couldn't find it in the in-game achievements or even the Steam achievements. When I decided I'd just pay and see how it goes, it crashed. At this point I was getting quite annoyed. After another five or so minutes I actually got into a game. Just about anyway. My first impressions were... just... amazement. Pure amazement, at how people could still play this game, and how there were even people willing to buy the DLC, which are not only overpriced, but most of the stuff isn't even permanent. Anyway, back to the game. The graphics are... well... ♥♥♥♥. So is the sound. And the controls (shift to walk and double-tapping W to run? Oh god...). The guns are a laugh. I have only spent about ten minutes in the actual game, so I haven't seen a lot of the guns, but I have seen the horribly butchered MP5A3 and G3A4. The MP5 has an EOTech optic, and when aimed, you seem to shove your face into the reticle. The G3, on the other hand, has absolutely no sights. Neither does the sidearm (which is a Glock of some sort; never took the time to take a close look at it). I'm probably missing a load of stuff here, and this review is likely all over the place, just like the game itself, because I rarely write reviews, but I just had to convey my anger here. All in all, the most enjoyment I had was uninstalling this despicable addition to the gaming industry in the past millenium.   Edit  I should actually mention that I never got the achievement because of the constant crashing and deplorable gameplay. I literally could not even complete my first match because of this. And I am never trying it again. Ever.
